RESPONSE TEXT: If you're ever able to lend a hand. Drop by.

RESPONSE TEXT: Loyalty's a two way street.

RESPONSE TEXT: I want you to have this. Consider it a token of our mutual understanding - and respect.
DIALOGUE AFTER: PackLeader: One last thing before I let you go.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: No shit. We've all seen it worse.
RESPONSE TEXT: Sure, this place beats living in the shit holes we had out there. But it ain't the palace of caps we signed on for.
SCRIPT NOTES: on an angry soap box / Angry

RESPONSE TEXT: Ain't none of us happy - not even the Disciples. And they're normally a chipper bunch so long as they're drenched in blood.

RESPONSE TEXT: Things were going to hell fast, but Gage put the brakes on that. Got us together and promised he'd find someone to deal with Colter.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Things could be worse. Trust me. I've seen it.
RESPONSE TEXT: No shit. We've all seen it worse.
DIALOGUE AFTER: PackLeader: Sure, this place beats living in the shit holes we had out there. But it ain't the palace of caps we signed on for.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I think you're a bunch of ungrateful children.

RESPONSE TEXT: We ain't ungrateful. Just fed up.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: So what is it you want?

RESPONSE TEXT: Anything that's more than the sitting around we been doing for the last year.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: We're all in this together. This can be good for everyone.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You gonna be a problem I need to solve?

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You don't want to be Overboss?

DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I have big plans for this place, you'll see.

DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I have big plans for this place, you'll see.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: But we thought Colter was the real deal, too. And he's laying in a pool of his own blood.
RESPONSE TEXT: Don't get me wrong. Colter was definitely Overboss. Not a man to mess with.

RESPONSE TEXT: And things were good in the beginning. Real good.

RESPONSE TEXT: But that was a year ago. Then Colter went soft. Wanted to "take stock in what we achieved."
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Things could be worse. Trust me. I've seen it.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You can trust me. I'll be a good leader.

RESPONSE TEXT: Might a been the whole point of the Gauntlet all along.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Let's work together, Mason. I'm not interested in ruining your gig.

RESPONSE TEXT: They've made too many enemies. Need you to go make them a friend.
SCRIPT NOTES: talking about enslaving someone - explaining a job to the player / SinisterSmile

RESPONSE TEXT: They've made what they think is a powerful ally. Turns out their ally is actually working for us... well, almost. Need you to prove me right.
SCRIPT NOTES: talking about enslaving someone - explaining a job to the player / SinisterSmile

RESPONSE TEXT: They have a special friend out in the wastes. I'm jealous. I want that friend for myself.
SCRIPT NOTES: talking about enslaving someone - explaining a job to the player / SinisterSmile

RESPONSE TEXT: They've made nice with one of my old friends, a friend that apparently needs to be taught a lesson in loyalty.
SCRIPT NOTES: talking about enslaving someone - explaining a job to the player / Irritated

RESPONSE TEXT: There's someone who needs to be put in their place... By which I mean, here in Nuka-Town, licking my toes.
SCRIPT NOTES: talking about enslaving someone - explaining a job to the player / SinisterSmile

RESPONSE TEXT: There's a dog who needs leashing.
SCRIPT NOTES: talking about enslaving someone - explaining a job to the player / Irritated

RESPONSE TEXT: Need someone tamed.
SCRIPT NOTES: talking about enslaving someone - explaining a job to the player / SinisterSmile

RESPONSE TEXT: Take this Shock Collar. Sneak up and slap it on when she ain't looking. Or, beat her senseless, and snap it on when she's down and out.
SCRIPT NOTES: explaining with grim satisfaction how to put a shock collar on someone... the collar explodes if they don't comply with the owners wishes / Conspiratorial

RESPONSE TEXT: I want you to collar her. Sneak up on her or beat her into submission. Either way, should be able to slap it on her without much fuss.
SCRIPT NOTES: explaining with grim satisfaction how to put a shock collar on someone... the collar explodes if they don't comply with the owners wishes / Conspiratorial

RESPONSE TEXT: Take this Shock Collar. Sneak up and slap it on when he ain't looking. Or, beat him to a bloody pulp, then snap it on when he's down and out.
SCRIPT NOTES: explaining with grim satisfaction how to put a shock collar on someone... the collar explodes if they don't comply with the owners wishes / Conspiratorial

RESPONSE TEXT: I want you to collar him. Sneak up on him or beat him into submission. Either way, should be able to slap it on him without much fuss.
SCRIPT NOTES: explaining with grim satisfaction how to put a shock collar on someone... the collar explodes if they don't comply with the owners wishes / Conspiratorial

RESPONSE TEXT: One of their own turned tail. We don't abandon packmates. Needs to be made an example of.
SCRIPT NOTES: talking about killing someone - explaining a job to the player / Angry

RESPONSE TEXT: One of theirs turned traitor and needs to be taught a lesson.
SCRIPT NOTES: talking about killing someone - explaining a job to the player / Angry

RESPONSE TEXT: One of their packmates stole from them and scurried off. We're going to make sure no one thinks of doing that again.
SCRIPT NOTES: talking about killing someone - explaining a job to the player / Angry

RESPONSE TEXT: They got a wastelander supplying them. But not for long.
SCRIPT NOTES: slyly asking the player to kill the ally of a rival gang / SinisterSmile

RESPONSE TEXT: They got an independent fixer setting them up with the good stuff. That ain't seem fair.
SCRIPT NOTES: slyly asking the player to kill the ally of a rival gang / SinisterSmile

RESPONSE TEXT: They got a patron in the Commonwealth who's been funding them. I'd like to redistribute some wealth. Go fetch me that patron.
SCRIPT NOTES: slyly asking the player to kill the ally of a rival gang / Irritated

RESPONSE TEXT: Some buck out in the wasteland paid us a ton of caps to take out a trouble maker. Didn't specify needing a corpse. So, I got a better idea.
SCRIPT NOTES: talking about killing someone - explaining a job to the player / SinisterSmile

RESPONSE TEXT: One of mine's gone and got domesticated by some cluck and abandoned the Pack. Must of forgot we're packmates for life. One way, or another.
SCRIPT NOTES: "domesticated" means fallen in love with. Talking about killing someone - explaining a job to the player / Irritated

RESPONSE TEXT: I got a loose end out in the Commonwealth. Need you to go help me tie that down.
SCRIPT NOTES: talking about killing someone - explaining a job to the player / SinisterSmile

RESPONSE TEXT: One of their own turned tail. We don't abandon packmates. Needs to be made an example of.
SCRIPT NOTES: talking about killing someone - explaining a job to the player / Angry

RESPONSE TEXT: One of theirs turned traitor and needs to be removed from the food chain.
SCRIPT NOTES: talking about killing someone - explaining a job to the player / Angry

RESPONSE TEXT: One of their packmates stole from them and scurried off. Everyone knows - you steal from the Pack, you pay with your life.
SCRIPT NOTES: talking about killing someone - explaining a job to the player / Angry

RESPONSE TEXT: They got a trader working for them, bringing them the good stuff. But not for long. Hard to earn a living as a corpse.
SCRIPT NOTES: slyly asking the player to kill the ally of a rival gang

RESPONSE TEXT: They got a fixer hooking them up with goodies. Need you rip a hole in that supply train.
SCRIPT NOTES: slyly asking the player to kill the ally of a rival gang

RESPONSE TEXT: Turned one of my spies against us. Can't have people walking around thinking they can back stab me. Not without getting stabbed themselves.
SCRIPT NOTES: slyly asking the player to kill the ally of a rival gang / SinisterSmile

RESPONSE TEXT: Some buck out in the wasteland paid us a ton of caps to take out a trouble maker. Need someone to make us good on that contract.
SCRIPT NOTES: talking about killing someone - explaining a job to the player / SinisterSmile

RESPONSE TEXT: One of mine's gone and got domesticated by some cluck and abandoned the Pack. Must of forgot we're packmates for life. Need you to be my reminder.
SCRIPT NOTES: "domesticated" means fallen in love with. Talking about killing someone - explaining a job to the player / Irritated

RESPONSE TEXT: I got some unfinished business in the Commonwealth. The kind best handled by a bullet to the brains.
SCRIPT NOTES: talking about killing someone - explaining a job to the player / Stern

RESPONSE TEXT: They scraped together a cache of goodies, but they ain't in a friendly neighborhood. They could use some help with the neighbors.
SCRIPT NOTES: explaining to player you want him to go help defend a cache of supplies destined for one of your outposts / Stern

RESPONSE TEXT: They scored some supplies but lost their caravan. They've come under fire and need support. Normally I'd let 'em rot, but I'm feeling parental today.
SCRIPT NOTES: explaining to player you want him to go help defend a cache of supplies destined for one of your outposts / Stern

RESPONSE TEXT: Their supply caravan got ambushed. They're hunkered down and want help. I'm feeling generous at the moment, so I'm sending guns.
SCRIPT NOTES: explaining to player you want him to go help defend a cache of supplies destined for one of your outposts / Stern

RESPONSE TEXT: Some cubs nosed up some goodies in the wastes. They also stirred up some trouble. Go bail their stupid asses out.
SCRIPT NOTES: explaining to player you want him to go help defend a cache of supplies destined for one of your outposts / Irritated

RESPONSE TEXT: One of our caravans got ambushed. They're holed up and licking their wounds, but trouble's close. Go help 'em, if they're not dead already.
SCRIPT NOTES: explaining to player you want him to go help defend a cache of supplies destined for one of your outposts / Irritated

RESPONSE TEXT: A trade deal went to shit - like they do. Our boys are hold up and taking fire. Go help them secure the goods.
SCRIPT NOTES: explaining to player you want him to go help defend a cache of supplies destined for one of your outposts / Stern

RESPONSE TEXT: They're having a little trouble convincing some new friends to share their stash of goodies. So we're just going to go and take it all instead.
SCRIPT NOTES: slyly asking the player to go steal supplies from a rival group (and to kill any defenders) / SinisterSmile

RESPONSE TEXT: They ran out of supplies. Normally I'd let 'em wallow in their stupidity. But I'm in a good mood today. I also know where we can borrow some supplies.
SCRIPT NOTES: slyly asking the player to go steal supplies from a rival group (and to kill any defenders) / Stern

RESPONSE TEXT: They got a sweet new cache of supplies. Trouble is, it's in the hands of someone else at the moment. Want to help 'em deal with that minor detail?
SCRIPT NOTES: slyly asking the player to go steal supplies from a rival group (and to kill any defenders) / SinisterSmile

RESPONSE TEXT: There's a cache of stuff that belongs to the Pack. The current owners think otherwise. We're going to put them in their place.
SCRIPT NOTES: slyly asking the player to go steal supplies from a rival group (and to kill any defenders) / Stern

RESPONSE TEXT: There's supplies the Pack wants that others have. What the Pack wants, the Pack goes and gets.
SCRIPT NOTES: slyly asking the player to go steal supplies from a rival group (and to kill any defenders) / SinisterSmile

RESPONSE TEXT: There's an outpost in the wastes that won't trade with us. So, we'll just go take what we want from them.
SCRIPT NOTES: slyly asking the player to go steal supplies from a rival group (and to kill any defenders) / SinisterSmile

RESPONSE TEXT: Got some rats nesting on a cache of supplies that belongs to the Pack. Care to help clean out the vermin?
SCRIPT NOTES: slyly asking the player to go steal supplies from a rival group (and to kill any defenders) / SinisterSmile

RESPONSE TEXT: Some Supermutants. Nothing you can't handle.
SCRIPT NOTES: answering question about mission: "who am I up against?" / Confident

RESPONSE TEXT: Supermutants.
SCRIPT NOTES: answering question about mission: "who am I up against?" / Confident

RESPONSE TEXT: Just some raider shit stains.
SCRIPT NOTES: answering question about mission: "who am I up against?" / Confident

RESPONSE TEXT: Raiders.
SCRIPT NOTES: answering question about mission: "who am I up against?" / Confident

RESPONSE TEXT: Couple Brotherhood of Steel aholes. You'll be doing the world a favor.
SCRIPT NOTES: answering question about mission: "who am I up against?" / SinisterSmile

RESPONSE TEXT: Brotherhood of Steel.
SCRIPT NOTES: answering question about mission: "who am I up against?" / Confident

RESPONSE TEXT: A handful of Minutemen. Anyone who thinks those wankers can protect them ain't never met a Pack member.
SCRIPT NOTES: answering question about mission: "who am I up against?" / SinisterSmile

RESPONSE TEXT: Minutemen.
SCRIPT NOTES: answering question about mission: "who am I up against?" / Confident

RESPONSE TEXT: Gunners. Those guys don't play nice. But neither do we.
SCRIPT NOTES: answering question about mission: "who am I up against?" / SinisterSmile

RESPONSE TEXT: Gunners.
SCRIPT NOTES: answering question about mission: "who am I up against?" / Confident

RESPONSE TEXT: Railroad "agents." Who do those guys think they are anyway?
SCRIPT NOTES: answering question about mission: "who am I up against?" / Irritated

RESPONSE TEXT: The Railroad.
SCRIPT NOTES: answering question about mission: "who am I up against?" / Irritated

RESPONSE TEXT: The Institute. A bunch of scared hens hiding behind their robots.
SCRIPT NOTES: answering question about mission: "who am I up against?" / Sarcastic

RESPONSE TEXT: The Institute.
SCRIPT NOTES: answering question about mission: "who am I up against?" / Sarcastic

RESPONSE TEXT: A nobody. Should be easy for you.
SCRIPT NOTES: answering question about mission: "who am I up against?" / SinisterSmile

RESPONSE TEXT: Just a fool. Should be easy pickin's.
SCRIPT NOTES: answering question about mission: "who am I up against?" / SinisterSmile

RESPONSE TEXT: How's that job going? You're still doing it, right?
SCRIPT NOTES: trying to not sound annoyed. Player is coming back before finishing what you told him to do. / Stern

RESPONSE TEXT: You're still up to that little task I gave you, yeah?
SCRIPT NOTES: trying to not sound annoyed. Player is coming back before finishing what you told him to do. / Stern

RESPONSE TEXT: Don't you have something you were doing for me?
SCRIPT NOTES: trying to not sound annoyed. Player is coming back before finishing what you told him to do. / Stern

RESPONSE TEXT: Alright.
SCRIPT NOTES: commanding, but to an equal - player told him he's still working on the quest. / Confident

RESPONSE TEXT: Don't keep me waiting forever.
SCRIPT NOTES: commanding, but to an equal - telling player he better hurry up and finish his part of the deal / Stern

RESPONSE TEXT: I trust you'll get it done. Eventually.
SCRIPT NOTES: commanding, but to an equal - telling player he better hurry up and finish his part of the deal / Stern

RESPONSE TEXT: You could be out there busting heads instead of here yapping with me.
SCRIPT NOTES: commanding, but to an equal - telling player he better hurry up and finish his part of the deal / Stern

RESPONSE TEXT: Good to hear.
SCRIPT NOTES: commanding, but to an equal l - player told him he's still working on the quest. / Confident

RESPONSE TEXT: Got word from one of our burrows.
SCRIPT NOTES: setting up the explanation of a job -- one of the gang's hideouts has a problem he wants the player to solve / Neutral

RESPONSE TEXT: One of our den's put out a call for aid.
SCRIPT NOTES: setting up the explanation of a job -- one of the gang's hideouts has a problem he wants the player to solve / Neutral

RESPONSE TEXT: Got a lair that need's assistance.
SCRIPT NOTES: setting up the explanation of a job -- one of the gang's hideouts has a problem he wants the player to solve / Neutral

RESPONSE TEXT: A nest out in the wastes put a call out.
SCRIPT NOTES: setting up the explanation of a job -- one of the gang's hideouts has a problem he wants the player to solve / Neutral

RESPONSE TEXT: One of the roosts got some trouble.
SCRIPT NOTES: setting up the explanation of a job -- one of the gang's hideouts has a problem he wants the player to solve / Neutral

RESPONSE TEXT: I want to cause a little ruckus for our so-called friends, the Operators.
SCRIPT NOTES: slyly, about to explain how the player can help cause trouble for the rival gangs / SinisterSmile

RESPONSE TEXT: I want to put those Operators in their place.
SCRIPT NOTES: slyly, about to explain how the player can help cause trouble for the rival gangs / Stern

RESPONSE TEXT: I want to cause a little ruckus for our so-called friends, the Disciples.
SCRIPT NOTES: slyly, about to explain how the player can help cause trouble for the rival gangs / SinisterSmile

RESPONSE TEXT: I want to put those Disciples in their place.
SCRIPT NOTES: slyly, about to explain how the player can help cause trouble for the rival gangs / Stern

RESPONSE TEXT: Well, ain't that sweet of you.
SCRIPT NOTES: sarcastic, but friendly (player agrees to do the job) / Sarcastic

RESPONSE TEXT: And here I thought I'd have to soften you up more.
SCRIPT NOTES: sarcastic, but friendly (player agrees to do the job) / Sarcastic

RESPONSE TEXT: No kiddin'? Alright then.
SCRIPT NOTES: sarcastic, but friendly (player agrees to do the job) / Sarcastic

RESPONSE TEXT: I'd a done it myself, but I got my hands full with the zoo.
SCRIPT NOTES: sarcastic, but friendly (player agrees to do the job) "zoo" meaning his gang members and their animals and slaves, etc. all his responsibilities / Sarcastic

RESPONSE TEXT: Good! All I got on hand are pups. I need someone I can trust on this.
SCRIPT NOTES: sarcastic, but friendly (player agrees to do the job)  / Happy

RESPONSE TEXT: Pffft. Whatever, boss-man.
SCRIPT NOTES: annoyed, sarcastic - but to someone who is an equal (player refuses to do the job)  / Irritated

RESPONSE TEXT: I'll root around for some other jerkoff to run my errands then.
SCRIPT NOTES: annoyed, sarcastic - but to someone who is an equal (player refuses to do the job)  / Sarcastic

RESPONSE TEXT: Big boss-man has big boss-man things to do. I got ya.
SCRIPT NOTES: annoyed, sarcastic - but to someone who is an equal (player refuses to do the job)  / Sarcastic

RESPONSE TEXT: Big boss-lady has big boss-lady things to do. I got ya.
SCRIPT NOTES: annoyed, sarcastic - but to someone who is an equal (player refuses to do the job)  / Sarcastic

RESPONSE TEXT: Sure, boss. Ain't no fur off my ass.
SCRIPT NOTES: annoyed, sarcastic - but to someone who is an equal (player refuses to do the job)  / Sarcastic

RESPONSE TEXT: Fine. I got plenty of wolves that want to earn their meat.
SCRIPT NOTES: annoyed- but to someone who is an equal (player refuses to do the job)  / Irritated

RESPONSE TEXT: Pffft. Whatever, boss-lady.
SCRIPT NOTES: annoyed, sarcastic - but to someone who is an equal (player refuses to do the job)  / Irritated

RESPONSE TEXT: Can't find the balls to give a straight answer? I'll find someone else.
SCRIPT NOTES: annoyed, sarcastic - to someone who SUPPOSEDLY is an equal (player refuses to do the job)  / Irritated

RESPONSE TEXT: Don't want to disappoint the Alpha. Alright. But I'm still taking that as a "no."
SCRIPT NOTES: annoyed, sarcastic - to someone who SUPPOSEDLY is an equal (player refuses to do the job)  / Irritated

RESPONSE TEXT: Letting me down easy? Not to worry. I got plenty of other wolves who want to earn their meat.
SCRIPT NOTES: annoyed, sarcastic - to someone who SUPPOSEDLY is an equal (player refuses to do the job)  / Irritated

RESPONSE TEXT: Can't bear to look me in the eye and tell me, no? Huh.
SCRIPT NOTES: annoyed, sarcastic - to someone who SUPPOSEDLY is an equal (player refuses to do the job) "Huh" to himself thinking "this guy aint so tough afterall" / Irritated

RESPONSE TEXT: Way to burrow your way outa things. Could have just said, "no."
SCRIPT NOTES: annoyed, sarcastic - to someone who SUPPOSEDLY is an equal (player refuses to do the job)  / Irritated

RESPONSE TEXT: Cock's out there kicking up dust in their business. Need that bird's feather's plucked.
SCRIPT NOTES: talking about killing someone - explaining a job to the player / Stern

RESPONSE TEXT: Got someone pissing in their watering hole. Needs to be taught a lesson. A permanent one.
SCRIPT NOTES: talking about killing someone - explaining a job to the player / Stern

RESPONSE TEXT: They made enemies they shouldn't have. Normally I let fools nest in their own filth. But I'm feeling generous. Care to help take out the trash?
SCRIPT NOTES: talking about killing someone - explaining a job to the player / Stern

RESPONSE TEXT: They made what they think is a powerful ally. Little do they know, alliances with corpses don't last long. If you catch my meaning.
SCRIPT NOTES: slyly asking the player to kill the ally of a rival gang / SinisterSmile

RESPONSE TEXT: They have a special friend out in the wastes. Would sure be a shame if something happened to that friend of theirs.
SCRIPT NOTES: slyly asking the player to kill the ally of a rival gang / SinisterSmile

RESPONSE TEXT: They made nice with one of my friends. I'm not feeling so friendly any more. Care to permanently end that friendship for me?
SCRIPT NOTES: slyly asking the player to kill the ally of a rival gang / SinisterSmile

RESPONSE TEXT: Got someone who needs to be put in their place... By which I mean "put in the ground."
SCRIPT NOTES: talking about killing someone - explaining a job to the player / Somber

RESPONSE TEXT: There's a buck whose throat needs tearing out.
SCRIPT NOTES: talking about killing someone - explaining a job to the player / Stern

RESPONSE TEXT: Need someone removed from the food chain.
SCRIPT NOTES: talking about killing someone - explaining a job to the player / Somber

RESPONSE TEXT: Go get 'em!
SCRIPT NOTES: pleased - player agrees to do what you asked him (kill someone, etc.), boosting your status among your peers as an equal / better than player / Happy

RESPONSE TEXT: I was hoping you'd say that.
SCRIPT NOTES: pleased - player agrees to do what you asked him (kill someone, etc.), boosting your status among your peers as an equal / better than player / Happy

RESPONSE TEXT: That's what I like to hear.
SCRIPT NOTES: pleased - player agrees to do what you asked him (kill someone, etc.), boosting your status among your peers as an equal / better than player / Happy

RESPONSE TEXT: Yeah. I thought you might like that.
SCRIPT NOTES: pleased - player agrees to do what you asked him (kill someone, etc.), boosting your status among your peers as an equal / better than player / Amused

RESPONSE TEXT: Wish everyone had your thirst for the chase!
SCRIPT NOTES: pleased - player agrees to do what you asked him (kill someone, etc.), boosting your status among your peers as an equal / better than player / Happy

RESPONSE TEXT: Well that didn't take long.
SCRIPT NOTES: friendly, sarcastically nonchalantly impressed (but you are). player just told you he completed the mission (to kill someone, ambush a caravan, etc.) / Friendly

RESPONSE TEXT: Back already?
SCRIPT NOTES: friendly, sarcastically nonchalantly impressed (but you are). player just told you he completed the mission (to kill someone, ambush a caravan, etc.) / Surprised

RESPONSE TEXT: Ain't you got the big ones.
SCRIPT NOTES: friendly, sarcastically nonchalantly impressed (but you are). player just told you he completed the mission. "big ones" as in balls / Amused

RESPONSE TEXT: Welcome back bucko.
SCRIPT NOTES: friendly, sarcastically nonchalantly impressed (but you are). player just told you he completed the mission. / Friendly

RESPONSE TEXT: You certainly can handle your shit, can't you?
SCRIPT NOTES: friendly, impressed. player just told you he completed the mission. / Impressed

RESPONSE TEXT: See people. That right there is how it's done.
SCRIPT NOTES: to underlings that could learn a thing or two from the player who just told you he completed the mission. / Confident

RESPONSE TEXT: You're Alpha, alright.
SCRIPT NOTES: friendly, impressed. player just told you he completed the mission. "Alpha" means "cool, the best, top dog" / Impressed

RESPONSE TEXT: Some said you couldn't do it. I had those assholes shot... No really.
SCRIPT NOTES: dead pan. player just told you he completed the mission (to kill someone, ambush a caravan, etc.) / Somber

RESPONSE TEXT: Back so soon? That's too bad. I didn't have time to arrange the party.
SCRIPT NOTES: friendly, sarcastically nonchalantly impressed (but you are). player just told you he completed the mission (to kill someone, ambush a caravan, etc.) / Sarcastic

RESPONSE TEXT: Welcome back. You just missed the parade we threw in your honor.
SCRIPT NOTES: friendly, sarcastically nonchalantly impressed (but you are). player just told you he completed the mission (to kill someone, ambush a caravan, etc.) / Sarcastic

RESPONSE TEXT: You probably expect some kind of reward? Fine. Here.
SCRIPT NOTES: friendly, sarcastic. You don't think the player needs any money. He's the overboss. But fair is fair. He did do the job you asked him to. / Sarcastic

RESPONSE TEXT: Don't spend this all in one place.
SCRIPT NOTES: friendly, sarcastic. You don't think the player needs any money. He's the overboss. But fair is fair. He did do the job you asked him to. / Sarcastic

RESPONSE TEXT: Here's a cut of the kill. I suppose you deserve it.
SCRIPT NOTES: friendly, sarcastic. You don't think the player needs any money. He's the overboss. But fair is fair. He did do the job you asked him to. / Sarcastic

RESPONSE TEXT: I don't 'spose you do things out of the kindness of your heart. So, take this and we'll call it even.
SCRIPT NOTES: friendly, sarcastic. You don't think the player needs any money. He's the overboss. But fair is fair. He did do the job you asked him to. / Sarcastic

RESPONSE TEXT: I can see the caps in your eyes. Here you go, you greedy mongrel.
SCRIPT NOTES: friendly, sarcastic. You don't think the player needs any money. He's the overboss. But fair is fair. He did do the job you asked him to. / Amused

RESPONSE TEXT: Not sure the big boss-man needs a piddley reward. But fair's fair. Here you go.
SCRIPT NOTES: friendly, sarcastic. You don't think the player needs any money. He's the overboss. But fair is fair. He did do the job you asked him to. / Sarcastic

RESPONSE TEXT: Not sure the big boss-lady needs a piddley reward. But fair's fair. Here you go.
SCRIPT NOTES: friendly, sarcastic. You don't think the player needs any money. He's the overboss. But fair is fair. He did do the job you asked him to. / Sarcastic

RESPONSE TEXT: I hate to part with this. But, you earned it.
SCRIPT NOTES: friendly, sarcastic. You don't think the player needs any money. He's the overboss. But fair is fair. He did do the job you asked him to. / Sarcastic

RESPONSE TEXT: It's my job as Pack Alpha to render up the spoils. Here, consider yourself spoiled.
SCRIPT NOTES: friendly, sarcastic. You don't think the player needs any money. He's the overboss. But fair is fair. He did do the job you asked him to. / Friendly

RESPONSE TEXT: Add this to your pile of caps.
SCRIPT NOTES: friendly, sarcastic. You don't think the player needs any money. He's the overboss. But fair is fair. He did do the job you asked him to. / Sarcastic

RESPONSE TEXT: Your cut.
SCRIPT NOTES: friendly, sarcastic. You don't think the player needs any money. He's the overboss. But fair is fair. He did do the job you asked him to. / Confident

RESPONSE TEXT: The rules of the Pack - you help chase down the prey, you share in the spoils. So yeah. You'll get some.
SCRIPT NOTES: annoyed, but trying to stay cool. Player is asking for a reward for helping you. "some" as in "yours" like "you'll get yours" / Confident

RESPONSE TEXT: Of course. I'll send a little scratch your way.
SCRIPT NOTES: annoyed, but trying to stay cool. Player is asking for a reward for helping you. He probably doesn't need the money. But whatever, he's your boss. / Confident

RESPONSE TEXT: That goes without saying.
SCRIPT NOTES: annoyed, but trying to stay cool. Player is asking for a reward for helping you. He probably doesn't need the money. But whatever, he's your boss. / Confident

RESPONSE TEXT: You hurting for caps? I find that hard to believe. But yeah. No problem. You'll get a cut.
SCRIPT NOTES: annoyed, but trying to stay cool. Player is asking for a reward for helping you. He probably doesn't need the money. But whatever, he's your boss. / Irritated

RESPONSE TEXT: I... uhh... uuuggghhhnn.
SCRIPT NOTES: You've been killed. / Neutral

RESPONSE TEXT: Okay. I won't lie. That hurt a little.
SCRIPT NOTES: You just took damage in combat. / InPain

RESPONSE TEXT: You're gonna pay for that.
SCRIPT NOTES: You just took damage in combat. / InPain

RESPONSE TEXT: Okay. I'm mad now.
SCRIPT NOTES: You just took damage in combat. / InPain

RESPONSE TEXT: If I look like I'm enjoying this, it's because I am!
SCRIPT NOTES: Threatening an opponent in the heat of combat. / Happy

RESPONSE TEXT: I think I'll wear you as a coat.
SCRIPT NOTES: Threatening an opponent in the heat of combat. / SinisterSmile

RESPONSE TEXT: Well ain't you the stubborn one. You really want to drag this out?
SCRIPT NOTES: Threatening an opponent in the heat of combat. / Sarcastic

RESPONSE TEXT: That's a lot of blood. Don't you think that oughta be on your inside?
SCRIPT NOTES: Threatening an opponent in the heat of combat. / Angry

RESPONSE TEXT: You're gonna wish you hadn't done that.
SCRIPT NOTES: Entering combat. / Angry

RESPONSE TEXT: I think I'm going to enjoy this.
SCRIPT NOTES: Entering combat. This is wry. You're not afraid of your opponent. / SinisterSmile

RESPONSE TEXT: Time to die.
SCRIPT NOTES: Entering combat. This is wry. You're not afraid of your opponent. / Neutral

RESPONSE TEXT: Do you know what it means to be Alpha? I do.
SCRIPT NOTES: arrogant and cruel / Confident

RESPONSE TEXT: Am I my brother's keeper? You better believe it. You mess with one of us, you mess with all of us.
SCRIPT NOTES: arrogant and cruel / Neutral

RESPONSE TEXT: The key to sitting on top is following the rules when you have to and breaking 'em when you can get away with it.
SCRIPT NOTES: arrogant and cruel / Amused

RESPONSE TEXT: I'da killed Colter myself. But wasn't sure how the other gangs would take that. Guess I should've.
SCRIPT NOTES: Neutral

RESPONSE TEXT: A piece of friendly advice. If you can't find your place quickly, someone else will put you in it for you.
SCRIPT NOTES: arrogant and cruel / SinisterSmile

RESPONSE TEXT: Nuka-World's looking good. And we're looking good in it.
SCRIPT NOTES: appreciative, and also bragging a little / Happy

RESPONSE TEXT: You ain't so bad. I was going to have you killed, but I changed my mind. You can thank me some other time.

RESPONSE TEXT: Welcome into our nest, boss. You earned a place in it.

RESPONSE TEXT: I trust you're not an idiot and see how the Pack is the only gang to put your faith in.

RESPONSE TEXT: The Disciples are crazy and the Operators can't be trusted.

RESPONSE TEXT: You're either very stupid or very brave, and we ain't spent enough time together for me to know which.

RESPONSE TEXT: You think I give a shit about you when you clearly don't give a shit about the Pack? Get out of here.

RESPONSE TEXT: I took 'em apart and made a little something different out of the parts. Was just going to be a toy for my pets. But it's more useful than that.
